info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 5:27PM PDT until September 01 at 7:15PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 715 PM PDT. * At 527 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported flooding on US-95 north of Vidal Junction. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Havasu Landing and Vidal Junction. This includes the following roads... Highway 95 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 1 and 46. State Route 62 in San Bernardino County between mile markers 91 and 135. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
